intro: Pedicularis × penzigii, commonly known as the Penzig's lousewort, is a hybrid species within the genus Pedicularis, which belongs to the family Orobanchaceae. It is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with intricate patterns. The plant is typically found in alpine and subalpine regions, growing in rocky or open habitats. Its leaves are basal and often covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and can reach up to 30 cm in height. Pedicularis × penzigii is a short-lived perennial that thrives in cool, moist environments, showcasing the adaptability of hybrid plants in specialized ecosystems.
